Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Erythrocyte Transfusion Effects on Pulmonary Gas Exchange in Surgical Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly allocated to receive their first transfusion as cell salvage (CS), washed stored, or unwashed stored erythrocytes.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 91 patients undergoing elective major spine surgery at a single center, with anticipated erythrocyte transfusion.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly allocated to receive their first transfusion as cell salvage (CS), washed stored, or unwashed stored erythrocytes.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the hypothesis that erythrocyte transfusion affects pulmonary gas exchange in surgical patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in PaO2/FIO2 ratio, measured 5 minutes before and 30 minutes after transfusion.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was not concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Ninety-one patients were randomised: 30 to CS, 31 to washed, and 30 to unwashed erythrocytes.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Ninety-one patients were randomised: 30 to CS, 31 to washed, and 30 to unwashed erythrocytes.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The change in PaO2/FIO2 was not significant in any group (CS: 9 ± 59; washed: 10 ± 26; unwashed: 15 ± 1) and did not differ among groups (P = 0.92).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
